hints.content: The parentheses tell us which two numbers to multiply first.

Kaley solved the equation by multiplying $(\redE{10}\times\purpleE{5})$ first, and then multiplying by $\maroonE{2}$.

$\begin{align}
\redE{10} \times \purpleE{5} \times \maroonE{2} &=(\redE{10}\times\purpleE{5}) \times\maroonE{2}\\\\
&=\blueE{50}\times\maroonE{2}\\\\
&=100
\end{align}$

In the new equation below, we want to multiply $(\purpleE{5}\times\maroonE{2})$ first, and then multiply by $\redE{10}$.

$\begin{align}
\redE{10} \times \purpleE{5} \times \maroonE{2} &= \redE{10}\times(\purpleE{5}\times\maroonE{2})\\\\
&=\redE{10}\times\goldE{10}\\\\ 
&=100
\end{align}$

question.content:
Kaley solved $\redE{10} \times \purpleE{5} \times\maroonE{2}$ using the equations below.

$\begin{align}
\redE{10} \times \purpleE{5} \times \maroonE{2} &=(\redE{10}\times\purpleE{5}) \times\maroonE{2}\\\\ 
&=50 \times\maroonE{2}\\\\\  
&=100
\end{align}$

**Use the equations below to solve $\redE{10} \times \purpleE{5} \times \maroonE{2}$ in a different way.**

||
-:|:-
$\redE{10} \times \purpleE{5} \times \maroonE{2}$ | $=\redE{10}\times($ [[☃ numeric-input 2]]${}\times\maroonE{2})$  |
|$= \redE{10}\times {}$  [[☃ numeric-input 3]]|
|$= 100$|
